verbatim_example: Could methadone offer me freedom from this lifestyle?
how to have a normal social life as a perpetually relapsing heroin addict?

I'm just sharing this to see if anyone else can relate and if anyone has anything to add or share with me? Those of you who are at a similar milestone, but also those of you who have gone through this stage who can share your experience as well?
I would love to stop it all but I'm living alone and not working, not having a distraction or something to normalize my routine makes withdrawal 10x's worse.

Sometimes I think a work routine, being around co-workers, etc will be good to establish before jumping off all the way. Sometimes I feel like I should just white knuckle another week of trying to go ct and see how I feel.
I've been 4 months sober. I'm doing better now with my cravings.

I've only got 5 months but I'm telling you. I'm so excited to wake up each day doing something I love. Helping other addicts who are suffering. Sobriety comes with real emotion, drive, initiative, charisma, some pain from the wreckage of our past, true insight, real friends who care about you and who you actually care about.
What can I do to make it thru detox without killing myself (or really wanting to).
Almost five days clean . I feel great all day, but I can't handle the wrestless legs at night. Tips please? I can't deal
I was terrified to give up the pills... I still haven't had the withdrawals I was expecting
How to deal with chronic pain without opiates?
I am scared bc I know I will want to use. I am scared bc i am new in my recovery.
I was very frank about my usage with him. He said I never had a drug problem and was not an addict.

I don't even remember how it's done. I am happy to be here, sober . I am starting to really mourn for ten years I lost to oxycontin and Xanax. I wonder what my life would be like now if I would never have taken that first pill.
I just want a 'normal' friend. I've never been friends with another addict, but I am so damn lonely. This is just so tempting. Just for today, I will not relapse. What about tomorrow tho
I celebrated by not using. It was hard, so hard to actually deal with all that pain, and all of those emotions, but I made it.
Six months ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something
Can't tell you how much more I love myself and life. If I can do it, any of you guys can.
But I’m able to deal and cope with it without loading up a shot of heroin to just push those feelings away for a few hours.
What a difference a year can make
I’m officially one year clean from opiates
how to have a life in recovery is implied by 'moving forward in my life' and 'Too much ahead of me this year to have those pills looming over me'

Day 3 was a mixed bag. Few emotional spells, morning GI subsided, worked 9 hours, small gym session, little marijuana, fair amount of food, 5.5 hours of sleep. Dropping the Lope to 6mg today, plan on working out after work, dropping the Benzo to .25mg today and .75mg tonight before bed.
I have accomplished quite a bit over days 1-5, I can't forget about that. Those are days I don't have to relive, today has been the hardest thus far.
Waking up to day 7. Sleep was total shit and so is this morning. Right now feels so discouraging.
One week down, working on day 8. So far I haven't been a huge crybaby like yesterday. Instead it's just a emotional void, no good or bad. I'll take that over just bad.
Eight days down, moving into day 9
I'm noticing glimmers... Piece by piece, glimmer by glimmer, I'm working to rebuild

This shit isn't easy... but that shouldn't be the reason you don't stop using. It's not supposed to be easy, you're trying to rescue your hijacked brain and body from something that's held it hostage for however long.

Still having gnarly morning GI that tapers off. Still can't totally relax without some restless feet. Lingering anhedonia that comes in waves. Still sorta anxious about the feeling of not enjoying day to day life things that I used to.
in hopes of pumping some natural feel good into my body
Just sticking to my daily regiment/diet etc and waiting for a wave of reprieve from this next phase
It feels like my body is trying to act normal and my brain is just a few steps behind. Sort of feels like I'm a more functional shell of myself... in a good way.

I can say that I have never had a craving in the 17 days up until that point. It hit me like a fuckin sack of bricks... started pouring sweat, plotting and rationalizing all the ways I could get around this security blanket that I've created, giving myself reasons as to why it would be okay

Feeling better every day, looking forward to maybe sleeping in this weekend? Whatever the fuck that means. I'm waiting for that one night where I just conk out for 8-9 hours so bad. Just hoping that I get more 'happy' waves this weekend so I can continue seeing mental progress.
Other than that it's a mental game at this point
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits, anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs. Hoping some of the above starts to clear out over the next week.
Sunday morning the fog rolled back in. Emotional, tons of GI issues, anxiety sweats, depressed, stir crazy, irritable, restless. Felt like day 4 of withdrawals out of the blue.
Only things lingering around at 25 days are morning GI, restless sleep, anxiety/anhedonia waves. I think it's gradually getting better but it feels sort of consistent over the last few days.
Today is a bad trigger day for me. This was the day of the month I would get my script refilled and normally start the process of one GREAT week followed by the cycle of withdrawal etc etc.
My body/brain are feeling anxious, depressed and just out of sync compared to 27-30. Almost feels like days 7-11 again.
being off dope feels so good
I have been off heroin for six days now
I haven't been using for almost two months
I'm struggling. But better than expected. If I don't make it I'll lose everything.
Each one is one closer to being better
I think I can do this
Im still only a few days clean, but im not turning back
This is the longest I've been sober in a year at least. You guys have helped so much. I love you all. You can do it. I know it.
Maybe I can be a normal person
Stick with it. I was hopeless. If I can do it, you can.
I've tried to quit 5 times in the last year or so. Start a program, leave the program. Get through detox, feel great and then 'just for the weekend' myself back into active addiction.
I'm going to take my 60 day chip today
I've got 4 months clean and sober - the idea of being in pain just riles me up. I know that there is no chance in hell that I can have any opiates without coming unhinged.

can I share the miracle that has happened to me in recovery? ... I didn't take one. I took the ibuprofen, and I relaxed and I got through the worst of it so far. I'm not obsessed with those pills right now. I feel like, 'this is not going to be the reason I relapse.'
I knew as soon as I took them, the mental obsession would return. I'm writing this and calling my sponsor today so that I'm honest, and keeping myself accountable.
think about what kind of life you really, truly, want to have and maintain. Make it a realistic and achievable goal.

how will that end. The best case scenario is that you don’t OD, in which case you would just be using, getting sick, spending all of your money, always worrying, and surrounded by people who similarly only care about themselves- not because they are inherently bad people- but because they too are a slave to their own addiction.

Myself as well as the large majority of opiate users I have met along my journey through recovery all have almost the same story... And those drugs are made by... the same companies that make the Percocet and the Oxy, etc. Seems to me they have figured out how to keep the money flowing, even when their previous ‘customers’ decide it’s time to stop.
I just want to write this so that those who are in the state and/or timeframe that I was in at this point two years ago to know that it gets so, so much better.
Clean for over two years... Why am I still searching this shit
I've been clean for two years, and ... being legitimately clean and sober for two years only works if you cut off everyone from your past.
Been clean two years, and the worst thing about a craving is...
Is anyone else here thankful they were addicts and are now in recovery?
Recovery is hard. I just have to remember I’m on the right path right now.
I've been sober for 13 months this coming Friday, my son is almost 8 weeks old, I'm gaining so much in my life and I'm actually happy, so why do I still want to get high?
don't give up. Just wanted to put it out there!
I am struggling atm. Depression is a big struggle and i just want to numb everything out. Im sick of the cravings.
Today is day 17 without heroin. Its been a struggle im still struggling with the mental sides of things and the depression but im ok i guess

Im really not sure if i can pick myself up after this relapse. I just feel like i just dont have the strength. Or like wat is even the point? No doubt this is how ill go.... Be off Heroin for awhile think im doing great and fine the ill likely be back on my fucking face and using.
Im 1 week heroin free. Not feel well today
waiting to here back from doctor about antideoressants
Im day 39 heroin and alcohol free
Today i am on day 50 heroin and alcohol free

I am depressed and still in hospital. Every day i wake up with depression and feeling alone and worthless with thourghts of suicide in my head, urges to use and drink and for me to die. Im on antidepressants waiting for it to start working.  im sick of feeling like this i want it to stop.
trying to not go fuck it all and go back to heroin
I am 23 days off alcohol and 27 off Heroin. That is good as i plan to keep the days going up :)
Back on the Road to Recovery
I am trying my best to sort everything out. Im trying to fit in with the normal ppl who dont do drugs and stuff.

I'm feeling slightly discouraged... it just seems like unless I completely change my life, I'm destined to fail. Has anyone else had this feeling early in the process, before talking to doctors, counselors, etc.? ... It makes me really sad to think I won't be able to go have a drink with friends, or go out on the weekends (without risk of relapse).
Getting sober REALLY is awesome. Here is my thought process on this from day 1 until now, just so you can get an idea of what it might look like for you.
I was willing to do anything to be clean

With only 60 days clean myself, I think I'm a little jealous that other opiate addicts are still using mind altering chemicals. In some weird way, I wish I could sill drink or smoke or take other pills, and those suppressed longings are turning into something different.
how many meetings do you go to per week
What is one thing you wish you could have that (you feel) would make your recovery easier/better/more enjoyable?
staying self aware and in the moment which is a huge part of recovery and growing as a person

I've never been with someone younger than me let alone 7 years; in fact I've pretty much only been with older girls. But her actual age doesn't really bother me. She's cool as fuck and has obviously been through a fair amount, already being in NA at that age. There's just something about it though... The whole one year rule is in the back of my mind. How can I expect someone to be where I need them to be, if I'm not where I need me to be? I get my 90 days 100% sober this week.
Life keeps on getting better. My life is filled with so much love instead of the bullshit it was filled with for so long
I'm pretty confident I'd be using if it wasn't for NA
Recovery is possible. It's definitely not easy at all but I guarantee that the results are beautiful
I guess I am still addicted to chaos
my first sober Halloween in 5 years
To anyone who is in early recovery, I want to tell you that it is possible to enjoy life without drugs.

There’s always hope and always someone to love you even in your darkest of times. Being truly happy is possible even when you have more issues than Vogue. If there’s those on this sub who are still using,There’s government programs available as well as rehabs such as BFC who do financial assistance.
How does an addict get back to having good values when addiction stripped them away?

I'm sure lots of you could probably relate. I know what I'm doing is trying to replace one addiction with another, which isn't necessarily healthy. However this is where I'm at in my process so the best I can do is share about it, seek advice and take the right actions to move forward.
if anyone has suggestions on how to keep busy and start enjoying everyday activities again
finishing up my fifth day sober-ish (on xanax rn) and through the worst of the physical WDs
I only hope that come tomorrow I'll be able to continue with my plan for sobriety in the new year
does anyone have suggestions on dealing with the boredom, and other tips for getting and staying clean? I really want to STAY clean this time
How to get a rush in sobriety
I quit dope about a month ago and have had really bad PAWS
Does my previous use mean that I’m more prone to WDs after just a few doses
45 days clean today and it’s been kinda rough lately
I want to quit both to live a completely drug free life... Any advice on how to do this without fear of relapsing?

I really need some advice. I only picked up a point of dope so since I have no tolerance that’ll last me through today then I guess I’ll figure out what to do. Please help me, I really want to just end it right now
I just want to know how some of you get through that
reconnecting with some friends who I lost to my addiction
how your day's going send me a message...having someone to be able to vent to or just have a conversation with
trying to get clean or struggling to stay clean
I cannot do it any longer.  I can't go anywhere, I can't do anything, without knowing I have seeds around.
To all reading this looking for help or inspiration you CAN do it, trust me if I can, anyone can.
11 days since I quit a daily PST habit of 2 1/2 pounds a day for about 2 years. I'm having a few potential issues I'm a bit worried about.
Any ideas when I should return to normal?
All in all I'm counting myself thankful, cause the flu/cold is nothing compared to being strung out and having to use. No thank you.

getting back in to therepy and had some concerns.  I've lived with depression since I was about 19 and have been on and off diff ssris and anti deppresents, and felt I had enough clean time to get a baseline intake done.
Throwing this out there for advice, encouragement, and the sense of community I craved and needed when first getting clean.
working on giving myself credit for things in therapy, and I've got about 6 months clean
To all you thinking of getting clean do it, you are loved, you are worth it.  To everybody currently clean, you are my inspirations and my navigators.
I am sober. I am alive. I am incredibly grateful
Crying for almost no reason. I got dizzy and nauseous and angry
Hold on guys, we can kick this shit!
It's the kind of day I used to deal with by taking a handful of pills, so things wouldn't bug me so much. Not tempted, just tired and weak.
after the hell of withdrawal I will never go down that road again
I'm HAPPY today. I mean I'm smiling at people. I'm thanking the bus driver for the ride. I'm excited about my muffin. I stretched and felt good. I am at work and don't hate being here.
I have been clean for two weeks now. No opiates. No drinking. No caffeine. Easy does it, being as nice to brain & body as possible.
I don't miss opiates terribly, I know they only lead to a very dark place and I don't want to go there
I am clean, I am alive, I am beginning to feel comfortable in my skin
my colon has finally forgiven me
I do not want to be a junkie thank you very much... I am still clean. I am alive. And I am thankful
I am five weeks sober. Grouchy, tired, but desperately glad to be alive
I am still weak, it's a long road back
I have been clean for ten weeks and three days -- I genuinely lost track. Life got busy, and I'm okay, and I've thought about it, and been tempted, but I'm still here.
I just... live. Sometimes it's boring. I trudge through. I am alive, mostly happy and I know I am no longer slowly killing myself
I could never pay bills, have a place to call my own, have Sixers season tickets (haha) or really just do anything productive. I lived to get high.

I do want to say there was a time in my addiction that I would cry leaving the block and think to myself 'why do I keep doing this?' ... I used to tell myself that I have done the damage to my brain and I can never truly be happy. I will say that all that shit is wrong. ... 2 years feels like 10... and it keeps getting better. ... give yourself enough time for things to change. Give it your all everyday, prove anyone who thinks you'll never be shit... wrong.
I got sober in 2014. A year later we reconnected. I helped get him County funding to get into rehab.
Don't feel like you've made things too bad or that you'll never reach a certain level of happiness again... hard work and honesty will take you places you won't believe.
I used to be one of those people who thought the dopamine levels in their brain would never be fixed and I was doomed to keep using in order to be happy.
How do you cope with the emotions of not being accepted as a normal human being even though you are doing all that you can do
Does anyone know of any programs that can help?
I want to want to get clean but it's hard to see it. I haven't used since the day but the cravings have been there 24/7. Very mild wds
I haven't touched an opiate in almost 5 months
I'm kicking my first one month habit, between a half and full point a day. Wds have been easy but at this stage is it too late to get back to baseline?
how could I help her think more like me in terms of the importance (or lack thereof) of down and convince her to make time for some professional counselling
kicked my h habit about 3 weeks ago and haven’t had the urge to use more than every now and then since
To my recovering bois, mad serious question
I just want to be back to normal so so badly
Day 5 and I feel so much better
I'm over the worst why go right back. I'm just feeling trapped and depressed. But another day sober. Come on number 6.
when you feel you need to get out at moments of clarity and joy let it happen to let the Trick know what they have been missing. It doesn't have to be 24hr lockdown after the initial withdrawls
I almost feel I need to be selfish for a little while and not think of the bad I have done and focus on the good thing I am doing now
I am ready to have a actual life and not this puppet show I have been putting on for everyone
But it does feel good to not have opiates pumping through me. I can tell the difference. Gotta keep my mind focused. Some advice could be useful.
crawling my ass out of bed is easier
being sober was great motivation for the day. And her saying I gave her the greatest birthday gift by being sober
Stay clean. Shit tends to work out in the end.
I want more than anything to be free from these chemical shackles. But I know it will feel AMAZING to be sober.

I genuinely feel like I'm almost back to who I was before the opiates took over my life. And this goes out to anyone out there who knows they need to bite the bullet. I PROMISE you, that not being chained to a pill or strip or powder is the way to go.

I am now 7 days clean from the subs. I can honestly say compared to cold turkey this was a BREEZE. I have been able to eat at least a bit every single day. My sleep has been decent fragmented but there.

To anyone out there who is on day 1 week 1 week 2 etc. I know how INSURMOUNTABLE it seems. But I PROMISE YOU if you just STAY THE FUCK AWAY FROM OPIATES, and have a vision of what you want your life to look like. It WILL fall into place.
it's been about 4 months off opiates and I have done it without any real support system besides my girlfriend and family
It's been 4 days since I did any opiates and hope I can continue to stay sober
Still on the road to recovery but I am doing my best

I love the feeling I get from being sober. Such a clean high ya might say. Emotions are actually working and I am not just a zombie. I don't need to get right in the morning just to feel well and enjoy my day. No longer a slave to the drug and god damn do I feel great.
I really want to grab my soul back from the depths of hell and bring it back into the present world where I can focus on bringing joy to other peoples lives and making a difference one day at a time
I know I do not want to pick up. Will go to outpatient and meetings as much as I can... I need to take my time and slowly reintegrate into society so the stress does not overwhelm me
24 days clean and focusing strictly on my psychical health (lifting/cardio) and mental health (meditation)

I don't know why but whenever I get yelled at or she is in tears, I can't help but smile. I know I don't want too and I geniuely feel horrible for what I've done in the past. I feel like my soul is still gone in a way.
I am sober now and decided to take my dog to the lake... I would not have been outside and saw that duck if the cosmos did not align in such a way for me to stay sober now for 6 weeks and 3 days
I could see how listening to this may help those earlier in recovery

Getting off it is the hardest but the longer you go, the better your life will be. Don't you want an SO and to live a better life. Your family doesn't want to bury you, that's a nightmare. Be smart if you are gonna use but try to see the light.
How can I get out? I am working 6 days a week so there is never time to go through withdrawls. I can’t do this anymore
I really need to know how I’m gonna be able to do this
I really think this time is the one I’m gonna be able to come out on the other side. As a free man.
I am sooo ready to start my new life
I still have running lava from my ass and only sleep five hours a night... However I feel like my personality is back, I have dreams (goals), and feel pleasure from doing stuff again
How is that even possible? Can I never become a chipper? I have been clean for a few months
Wanna try sober living like as an experience or something, hope it works out cuz if I’m not happy sober I’ll go back to dope and be dead before 2020 hits
Being clean is hard but if I keep it up mabye some day I won’t have to keep fighting the urge to use or to kill myself
I want to quit now while I am still ahead to some extent and get back to my meetings and do the deal
So far I made it about two and a half days, last dose was Wednesday afternoon...I really need your guys help to get through this work week sick and not able to sleep
So far I made it about two and a half days, last dose was Wednesday afternoon...I really need your guys help to get through this work week sick and not able to sleep
How long does it take to officially get your sleep back, another week? ... When did you guys get your energy back?
how do I stay true to myself this time around?
Any advice? Has anyone else got clean and started feeling this way?
I'm close to the end of day 12 of being sober and I am extremely stressed about going to work. I'm shaking as I'm writing this. I feel physically well but mentally fucked.
Any idea on what to expect for withdrawal from only a 2 week run? Will it be just as bad when I came off my 5 month run?
I’m really struggling with my heroin addiction and need help, again.
did I just put myself back at day one again of withdraws?
trying to function as a normal human being has been the hardest thing I ever done

I’m closing in on about two weeks clean and I still can’t sleep to save my life. It’s starting to become a quality of life issue at this point. ... Any advice? I feel like this insomnia will never end? Is it something I’ll just have to ride out?
how long did it take for sleep to return?
will this one night cause bad physical withdrawals again after being two weeks clean or will I just have that hangover feeling and feel tired and groggy for a few days?
What do you do to stay clean? ... Is it even possible to get clean from home? ... I want 2018 to be a clean and happy year so bad

I managed to get clean for a few weeks. Caved and started chipping every 72 hours and now I’ve been using everyday again for the past couple weeks. I’m going to try to quit again at home yet AGAIN but if it fails I’m going to try to get into rehab yet AGAIN

Just have no clue how I’m going to get through these next 3 days of work but atleast I’m off Friday Saturday and Sunday if I can make it there without completely loosing my mind. Any advice or motivation is greatly appreciated
I’ve been waking up with a lot of anxiety which sucks but it does seem to fade once I start my day and get moving

how long did it take to feel like your was brain was pumping out them juices again? Not fully recovered but once you started to feel a difference in your mood, energy, anxiety, cravings and all that good stuff. What stuff did you do to help your brain recover faster?
I want to live my life to the fullest
I’m newly clean (got 10 days completely sober), and need help with my car (one of my main using spots)

Been clean for about 45 days and my guy just hit me up for the first time. I’ve been killing it in college with getting all A’s and about to graduate this may. Now relapse comes calling... fuck I was not prepared for this. Any advice?
what can I experience after 2 days?
we want to go to NA meetings and get whatever help we can get
I want to get help, I wish I quit a while ago before things got worst. I wish I can send my girlfriend who I and her are homeless now to rehab for a while
trying to get through each day without having to WD
what significant or little changes have you noticed in yourself?

I'm 24 hours into withdraw and it's tough. I have to say I don't feel as bad, physically, as I did when coming off oxy. But my state of mind is in the trash. I'm not suicidal, but I'm the closest I've been to feeling that depressed again in almost 10 years. I feel like I can't go to NA, because I can't be around other addicts... I'd really like some advice from anyone that's been in a similar situation.
This is my first sober weekend so I'm staying busy
Today is day 13 for me! This is the longest I've been sober since summer 2011, and first time I'm really sober.

It's day 20 for me. Tomorrow will be 3 weeks sober, which is incredible to me. This is already the most real clean time I've ever had without using illicit substances. Still fighting strep throat, which in early recovery really sucks. I'm staying strong though. I'm amazed how well managed my cravings are, and how normal I feel.
What have you done for your recovery this weekend?
I'm 4 weeks sober, 28 days yeah yeah! ... I'm clean another day and thankful for that!
I know I can stay sober one more day, and it's my hope you all will too!

But, I am clean, and life is good! Weather you're just starting off, restarting, or you have years of clean time, stay clean just for today. Don't give up on yourself, and keep your eye on that prize! We all can, and will, get our lives back in time.
Trying to move forward, and have another day sober under my belt

I've decided to go. All my friends know I am in recovery and will not be drinking with them. ... I'm looking forward to actually remembering my trip and the wedding. This will be the first trip I have every taken sober, and I'm really looking forward to it.
I've found a new way of life, partially by focusing on my new associations. It's really important to build out a sober network. Doing that makes recovery so much easier.
even if you just have the desire to stop using

How's everyone's Sunday going? ... Been trying to pick up on hobbies like sneakers, movies, working on my car, etc. Shits been going pretty well. I have good days and bad days. ... Anyway, it gets a lot easier. Life's so much fucking better now even on my worst days. Hang in there if you're struggling.

I'm grateful for everyday I wake up feeling like a normal person. I'm grateful for this sub because it was the place I could come to to vent and hear from others trying to kick the habit while I was going thru withdrawal. I would disappear for months at a time, but every time I came back I was welcome with open arms. I'm grateful that this 23 time has seemed to be the charm. I'm grateful I was finally able to make it past the first week, the first month to get to the point where the haze began to clear and I was able to start seeing that I really could have a better life.
If your on day 1 or just struggling just know that it gets so much better if you just stick it out and put in some effort.
Could I get help with a quick taper schedule
Any advice or help holler at me

I haven't done opiates in 10 months and I still fantasize about doing dope constantly.  And dream about scoring, or remembering a misplaced gram in my room every night.  Seems like it should be easier by now but while I'm normal physically I'm still obsessed.
I want to enjoy life again

Is it normal to be very emotional during this time. Here I am, a person who is 21, and almost crying because of how amazing my life has become. Everything has been positive, and getting physically dependent on pills has been my number one roadblock.
After 90 hours since my last oxycodone dose, I can officially say that I am withdrawal free (with minor exception)
I'm on day 14 now. Every day is a little but better but also a little bit harder. I've had to call on my clean friends and therapist every single day for the past week. Hanging on for dear life here.
Doing the work. Hating it but doing it and feeling proud of myself at times for doing it.

What do you all think about smoking weed during this period? Do you find that it resets your brain recovery? Sets you up for a fall? Do you find the cravings for DOC worse over the next few days? Or do you find it as an actual quitting aid?
I truly want to be free

I'm on day 6 here. Doing the moping at home thing. I've been on the phone all morning with therapist and support network and it's frustrating because rationally, there is absolutely no reason that I would trade a clean life to go grab ever again.
I never want to feel that again
looking forward to the business of getting my shit together and perhaps finally working at some of my root issues

Woke up this morning in a completely different world to my morning yesterday. Life was simple in rehab. Wake up, make my bed. Gratitude list (super helpful for me), drink coffee, already laughing within 5-10 minutes of waking up, smoke, eat, class, small groups, blah blah, but always laughing or doing work, real work, soul work. Choice was there, but limited. The real world is full of a million choices.
Has anyone experienced being a new parent in early recovery? About to be a dad—looking for feedback, advice or encouragement
Hi. I'm still clean after 6 months. I'm trying to adjust to being a father of a 4-month-old.

I had enough, had enough of the nasty feeling the lonely nights and dull needles. I was coming off almost a year habit of a ball a day and took those subs 4 of them the first night and 2 for a few days tell they were gone and the next thing I did was attended na meetings every fucking day.
I managed to kick a 8 ball a day habit on 9 suboxin
I've been without heroin for a little bit now, I've had my ups and downs, and it has seemed a lot easier this time around
haven't touch heroin/opiates in a year
I just wanna be free again. I really hate the junkie life. Early sobriety is easy enough for me after the first 7 days.
I want to be free so bad and I know the only way to do that is to be strong and abstain
I'm almost to the other side of this and can't wait for freedom! Onto day 5! ... I had a year clean last year before this relapse and man I can't wait to get back to sobriety

I know that time is dragging so slowly while you're sick. A minute is a lifetime. This is one of the most difficult things you will ever do, physically and mentally, in your life. But you CAN do it. You're SO much stronger than you think. The human body is an amazing thing. You can do this. Thousands of people before and after you have and will do this too. But once it's done, you don't ever have to do it again. You're so close to freedom and happiness.
I have a little over 18 months clean but I just can't take the crushing sense of anxiety, depression and loneliness.

I have been able to do so much since I've gotten sober from IV heroin and everything else. I have traveled to five continents this past year. I have been able to see friends I've made over these past four years and from before. I have been able to go to sporting events, even spending hundreds on a game. I have been in and lost relationships. I have made friends and lost some. I have built such strong connections to people. I have been able to have successes and failures. I have been able to save money, invest and look forward to a future that has infinite possibility.
